hints_html: Remember divisibility rules. A number is divisible by 9 if the sum of its digits is divisible by 9 and it is divisible by 11 if the alternating sum of its digits is divisible by 11.
hints_latex:
Remember divisibility rules. A number is divisible by 9 if the sum of
its digits is divisible by 9 and it is divisible by 11 if the
alternating sum of its digits is divisible by 11.
hints_raw: Remember divisibility rules. A number is divisible by 9 if the sum of its digits is divisible by 9 and it is divisible by 11 if the alternating sum of its digits is divisible by 11.
sols_html:
Proceeding as stated in the hint, notice that the sum of the digits of a is

\(\displaystyle (8+5)n = 13\cdot3^{100}\)

and this is clearly divisible by 9. Thus a is divisible by 9. Further, the alternating sum of the digits is

\(\displaystyle (8-5)n = 3\cdot3^{100}=3^{101}\)

and this is clearly not divisible by 11. Thus a is not divisible by 11.
sols_latex:
Proceeding as stated in the hint, notice that the sum of the digits of
\emph{a} is

$\displaystyle (8+5)n = 13\cdot3^{100}$

and this is clearly divisible by 9. Thus \emph{a} is divisible by 9.
Further, the alternating sum of the digits is

$\displaystyle (8-5)n = 3\cdot3^{100}=3^{101}$

and this is clearly not divisible by 11. Thus \emph{a} is not divisible
by 11.
sols_raw:
Proceeding as stated in the hint, notice that the sum of the digits of ''a'' is 

<math> \displaystyle (8+5)n = 13\cdot3^{100} </math>

and this is clearly divisible by 9. Thus ''a'' is divisible by 9. Further, the alternating sum of the digits is

<math> \displaystyle (8-5)n = 3\cdot3^{100}=3^{101} </math>

and this is clearly not divisible by 11. Thus ''a'' is not divisible by 11.
statement_html:
Let \(\displaystyle n = 3^{100}\) and \(\displaystyle a = 8585...85\) be the \(\displaystyle 2n\) digit number where the digits 85 repeat n times.

(a) Is a divisible by 9?

(b) Is a divisible by 11?

Explain your answers.
statement_latex:
Let $\displaystyle n = 3^{100}$ and $\displaystyle a = 8585...85$ be the
$\displaystyle 2n$ digit number where the digits 85 repeat \emph{n}
times.

(a) Is \emph{a} divisible by 9?

(b) Is \emph{a} divisible by 11?

Explain your answers.
statement_raw:
Let <math> \displaystyle n = 3^{100} </math> and <math> \displaystyle a = 8585...85 </math> be the <math>\displaystyle 2n </math> digit number where the digits 85 repeat ''n'' times. 

(a) Is ''a'' divisible by 9?

(b) Is ''a'' divisible by 11?

Explain your answers.
